title: A1989 820-00850-A no backlight
message:
Hi,

I have an A1989 820-00850-A, that after display replacement, it losed the backilght. I've tried with the old screen (broken display but full working), and now it also dosen't have backlight with the old display.

It boots to the loading bar with normal backlight, but after a while, before the bar full loads, and just before the login screen appears, the backlight decreases.

Probably something went wrong on the replacement, but I can't see nothing damaged.

Can you help?

title: A1989 820-00850-A no backlight
message:
So you can't increase the backlight with touchbar controls?
Did PRAM and SMC reset?
May have a problem with the ALS.

Just in case, try DFU revive.

title: A1989 820-00850-A no backlight
message:
Hi,

I can increase the backlight with touchbar, but it is not enough. It can't even notice but I can see the bar increase. 
The strange think is that when I boot the Mac in diagnostic mode, the backlight stays on (OK) until I shutdown the Mac. I tried living it on for 2 hours and it always was normal for that time.

title: A1989 820-00850-A no backlight
message:
Same happens loading macOS in safe mode?

Save data and try DFU restore; if revive didn't help.

title: A1989 820-00850-A no backlight
message:
Hi,

Same thing in safe mode, and neither restore or revive DFU resulted...

title: A1989 820-00850-A no backlight
message:
"Did PRAM and SMC reset?"
???

"May have a problem with the ALS."
You should try another known good LCD assembly.
At least change security settings and test booting Windows from USB.

title: A1989 820-00850-A no backlight
message:
Hi,

I already disabled the Automatic Light Sensor on macOS settings, and tried with an USB macOS, with the same result. Already done NVRAM and SMC reset without success.
Booting from a Windows USB always fails, and already tried WIN7 and WIN 10.

title: A1989 820-00850-A no backlight
message:
Hi,

I saw in some forums that this model has problems with the serialization (don't know if makes sense). Can it be something related with that?

title: A1989 820-00850-A no backlight
message:
Something happened in the screen replacement process.
I didn't hear someone else to get similar problem.
Shouldn't be software issue; even more, after DFU restore and macOS reinstallation.

title: A1989 820-00850-A no backlight
message: Any idea where, and what, I should start to check on the board?

title: A1989 820-00850-A no backlight
message:
The strange thing is that problem appears only when macOS load drivers.
That makes me think about ALS.
Any error comes up starting in diagnostic mode?

Check for knocked of components, or broken traces.

title: A1989 820-00850-A no backlight
message:
HI,

Yes, the problem only appears when Mac load drivers (just before the ending of the loading bar, and always at the same point). If left on the diagnostics mode, the backlight stays normal forever.
The diagnostic mode doesn't present any error.

I've done a lot of checking, several times, and I can't see any knocked components or broken traces, or anything damaged.

Any other ideas?

title: A1989 820-00850-A no backlight
message:
Test disconnecting webcam from T-CONN.
That will disable ALS.

title: A1989 820-00850-A no backlight
message:
Hi,

Sorry, but I don't know how to do it. 
How can I disable webcam, if it is in the same display connector?

title: A1989 820-00850-A no backlight
message:
I mentioned T-CONN board; there are 3 connectors.
Not really dificult to find the one for webcam.

title: A1989 820-00850-A no backlight
message:
HI, 

Right now, the display isen't recognized any more. When I connect an external display, it doesn't recognize the internal display, and the login screen appears on the external display.

title: A1989 820-00850-A no backlight
message:
Try again with original LCD.
Or use known good LCD assembly for test.

title: A1989 820-00850-A no backlight
message:
Hi,
same result with original LCD and a known good one.
Display not recognized anymore.

title: A1989 820-00850-A no backlight
message:
So you've lost image on internal LCD even before loading macOS?
DP_INT_HPD no present anymore?
Check 3V3/5V_S0SW_LCD, at least in the first seconds.

title: A1989 820-00850-A no backlight
message:
Yes, the macOS loads directly to the external display. No image shown on internal LCD.

I don't have  DP_INT_HPD (0V), but I have 1.7V on XDP_ DP_INT_HPD (not sure if it matters).

3V3_S0SW_LCD = 3.3V
5V_S0SW_LCD = 5.1V

title: A1989 820-00850-A no backlight
message:
DP_INT_HPD comes from LCD assembly.
You should change small video cable and check J8500 contacts.
PCH may also pull down the signal, if has an internal damage.
